IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE- V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES)
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
Present:-Smt. Aswathy. S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Tuesday the 4" day of February, 2025./ 15" Magha, 1946.
CC. 743/2018
Complainant : State-represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Poonthura
Police Station in Crime No. 146/2018.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused : 1. Vinayakumar, aged 55 years, S/o. Raveendran,
Thottumukku Veedu, TC. 63/3264, Moonnattumukku,
Puthanpalli Ward, Muttathara Village.
2. Navas, aged 48 years, S/o. Subair, Kadayara Veedu, TC.
48/1019, Near Thiruvallam Bridge, Puthanpalli Ward,
Muttathara Village.
( By Advocate Sri. C. S. Vijayachandran Nair)
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i), 323 and 341
read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence/Order : Accused Nos. 1 and 2 are found not guilty of offences
punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i), 323 and 341 read with
34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are acquitted of the said
offences under section 255(1) Code of Criminal Procedure.1973.
Description of accused
1..Vinayakumar Muttathara Village | Thiruvananthapuram

2 OF 6

30.01.2025 01.02.2025 04.02.2025 No delay
This case having been finally heard today, the court delivered the following:
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i), 323
and 341 read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. Prosecution case in brief is as follows:- Due to the previous enmity, on
04.01.2018, at 17.00 hours, Near Thiruvallam Bridge, Puthanpalli Ward,
Muttathara Village, accused nos. 1 and 2 wrongfully restrained CW1 and
uttered obscene words and threatened him. It is alleged that accused no.1
slapped on the cheek of CW1. Thus the accused nos. 1 and 2 have committed
offences punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i), 323 and 341 read with 34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed before this court by the Sub Inspector of police
Poonthura police station and the case was taken on file as CC. 743/2018.

3 OF 6
Cognizance was taken for the offences punishable under sections 294(b),
506(i), 323 and 341 read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860

4. On appearance of accused Nos. 1 and 2 they were enlarged on bail on
10.01.2018 On their appearance relevant records of prosecution were served
u/s. 207 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. Particulars of offences
punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i), 323 and 341 read with 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 read over and explained to the accused Nos. 1 and 2 to
which they pleaded not guilty and claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 was examined and Exhibit. P1 was marked.
As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the learned
Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW2 to CW8. In the absence of any
incriminating circumstances against the accused persons questioning of the
accused Nos. i and 2, under section 313(1)(b) of Code of Criminal Procedure,
1973 was dispensed with. Accused Nos. 1 and 2 were called upon to adduce
evidence but no defence evidence was adduced from the side of the accused
Nos. 1 and 2.

6. Heard both sides.

7. Points that arose for consideration are as follows:-

1. Whether on 04.01.2018, at 17.00 hours, accused nos. 1 and 2, infurtherance
of their common intention, uttered obscene words towards PW1, Near

40f6
Thiruvallam Bridge, Puthanpalli Ward, Muttathara Village and thereby
committed offence punishable under section 294(b) r/w. 34 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860?

2. Whether at the same time and place accused no.1 and 2 infurtherance of
their common intention, threatened to kill PW1 and thereby committed an
offence punishable under section 506(i) r/w. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860
?

3. Whether at the same time and place, accused no.1 and 2 infurtherance of
their common intention, accused no.1 slapped on the cheek of PW1 and
thereby committed an offence punishable under section 323 r/w. 34 of In-
dian Penal Code, 1860 ?

4. Whether on the same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 2 infurtherance of
their common intention, wrongfully restrained PW1 and thereby committed
offence punishable under section 341 r/w. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

5. If the accused Nos. 1 and 2 are found guilty? What is the order as to
sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 to 4 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point nos. 1 to 4 are
considered together. Prosecution case is that the accused Nos. 1 and 2 have
committed offences punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i), 323 and 341
read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860

9. PW1 admitted her signature in the Ext. P1. She deposed that the accused
persons have not assaulted he and she has no grievance against the accused
persons.

5 OF 6

10. Learned Assistant Public Prosecutor has given up the other witnesses in this
case and she is justified in doing so as the material witness failed to support the
prosecution case. There is nothing on record to disclose that the accused Nos. 1
to 4 have committed the offences as alleged by the prosecution. Having
considered the evidence on record, this court is of the view that the
prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of the accused persons and for the said
reasons, these points are found against the prosecution.

11. Point No. 5:- Upon the findings in Point Nos. 1 to 4, the accused Nos.1 and 2
are found not guilty of offences punishable under sections 294(b), 506(i), 323
and 341 read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are acquitted of the
said offences under section 255(1) Code of Criminal Procedure.1973. Their
bail bonds stands cancelled and they are set at liberty.

No material objects are produced in this case.
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 4" day of February, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.

6 OF 6
